text: PCA diagonalizes the covariance matrix (ie remove correlations) but does not normalize the variances to 1, so I don't think it qualifies at a whitening transformation. On the other hand I'm pretty sure that for any orthogonal matrix you can find some covariance matrix that gets withened by it, but that seems like a strange thing to consider.

text:
You can build a withening transformation using PCA by rescaling yes.
```W = D^{-1/2} P```
gives you a withening matrix for your data for `P` the PCA projection matrix and `D` the diagonalized covariance matrix. The resulting projection matrix `W` is no longer orthogonal though (the only case when PCA is withening directly is when all eignvalues of the covariance matrix are 1 to begin with). And also yes something is withening/decorrelating only relative to some data/random variables.
